NPCResponse: It’s a wretched semblance of life, a body without a soul. \n\nWe may not age here, but our minds do. Some give in to despair and madness, others lose themselves completely. There’s nothing worse.
I hope so, because we need it. We must get the Windmills going again, and then recover any sacks of grain that remain untainted. \n\nBut the Lost Swarmancers and Withered are everywhere!

PlayerPrompt: It's safe, you can leave this place.
NPCResponse: Oh, bless you, my friend! I felt my hope fading away! I almost became Withered!
Thank you. My family, my farm, all Lost… I'm the only one left.
About time someone came to help! Meet me at the edge of the farm - we should talk!
I've only just returned from completing my Druidic studies at another warren in the north. \n\nSeeing what's happened to everyone… I can't imagine what happened here. Some kind of curse?

I was by the mill, watching as the Druids spread their verdant blessings. Then suddenly, the blessings turned putrid and began emitting green smoke! \n\nThe Druid nearest me just fell over… and transformed!

No, I was napping in my old chair, when I was startled awake by a Withered bursting through the door! \n\nI think it was young Harrison, poor boy... I ran and hid, and saw nothing more until you came.

PlayerPrompt: "I was sent to find the Iron Rose Company."
NPCResponse: I'm praying I'm not the only one left! We were supposed to fall back to this location if we were overrun. \n\nBut I've seen no other members of the Iron Rose!

PlayerPrompt: "The way is clear now so get moving!"
NPCResponse: Yes, you're right! I can't just stand here awaiting death! My thanks to you, stranger! \n\nBrace yourself, Gideon, you can do this…
Bah! As I've said countless times now, we sent the damn tribute! We can't always guarantee the caravan's safety! \n\nAnd if that vicious Sorceress wants a war over this, we should give her one!

PlayerPrompt: "Just tell me where to find them."
NPCResponse: There are a few pirate dens in Windsward, but it was the Buccaneer Creek bastards that took the tribute. \n\nWord is those pirates are Lost now, so I'm not going after them. But you're the hero, so you go.

Ah, now it makes sense! I scouted the place and noticed they seemed to have a boat load of supplies. \n\nMaybe that's your tribute! But hey, if you’re going in there, grab some loot. We'll split the profit.

You did it! I may have sensed some kind of change in the flora here. Of course, I'm just an apprentice Druid. \n\nYour friend Grace seems a little disappointed. I think she had other plans for the gemstone.

My thoughts exactly. I'll visit the library in Corinth to try and find the location of the other shrines. \n\nHonestly though, I’d love to see the expression on Francis Turner's face. Talk about priceless.
There's one of those Spirit Shrines over that way, if that's your fancy. \n\nI prefer an honest walk myself. Either way, I'll race you. I'll have that Speaker strung up before you even get there!

Good. If we can get him on our side, and maybe a couple more, we'll have a little revolution started. \n\nYou go talk to your Quartermaster mate, and I'll hit the tavern. Always the best place for conspiring, you know?

PlayerPrompt: "He made a deal with the pirates. I have proof."
NPCResponse: Oh, I simply must see this… Hah! The dirty liar's been caught red-handed! \n\nBut we need to be strategic here. We'll need strength in arms if we're to challenge the Speaker. We've got you, but then maybe a soldier or two?

PlayerPrompt: "Can we take a rubbing of it?"
NPCResponse: Great minds think alike! I've already procured you some charcoal and parchment. \n\nMoira also mentioned the Bottomless Cup has the first half of the map. Might be worth checking out before heading to Breakwater.
Yes, everyone keeps telling me, the location of some stolen jewels, right? \n\nThe Company of the Iron Rose is well-versed in the arts of persuasion. My blade can be very convincing.
That? Why I’ve never seen it before! If you found that here in the Town Hall, it must have been planted. \n\nIt was probably Captain Dupont! As the Speaker, I order you to apprehend that… traitor!

PlayerPrompt: "I have your hat, Marcel. One chance to come clean."
NPCResponse: My hat? I believe I lost that in, uh, town. Someone must have picked it up. \n\nMy hat proves nothing.

Well enough. Grace managed to keep Leovix distracted in the tavern long enough to get Francis and Captain Dupont out of town. \n\nOh, and then everyone had to go and elect me as the new Speaker of the Winds.

I could have, had I wanted to. But no, some fool's meddling with the shrines accomplished that. I am vexed, however, quite vexed. \n\nI've been forced to come here and deal with this. Arousing my ire is not wise.

PlayerPrompt: "Then we do it the hard way."
NPCResponse: Well, just know this Captain Korrapati was particularly nasty before. She's likely worse now. She also has a pet alligator. \n\nI hope you ate a fortifying meal before leaving town. I think you're going to need it.

PlayerPrompt: "Of course, just tell me where to go."
NPCResponse: The caravan came under attack at the Bulrush Wash river crossing. I'm told it's a full onslaught of Lost. \n\nRecover what you can, including the Speaker's letter to Medea. I'll prepare a new wagon. Strength be with you!
Think you a wagon full of goods can appease me? When you have also defiled the shrines I crafted here? \n\nNo, Windsward must suffer far more before I relent.

The decision is not without its perils. But imagine how I could’ve helped Windsward if I had possessed Medea's gifts. \n\nThis power can be used for great good. I will devote my life to making it so. I dearly hope we meet again.

PlayerPrompt: "There is splendor in the flora. Take this sprig."
NPCResponse: What is this… it's… remarkable. The light in the branches, see how they shimmer. Has the sky always been so gorgeous?\n\nI couldn't tend to such a marvel. But perhaps you could. Here, take this pot. Keep it thriving forever.

PlayerPrompt: "I find zeal in wyrdwoods. Have a sprig."
NPCResponse: The light in the stem, it looks like it's dancing. Oh, is it responding to my voice? That's cheeky.\n\nI couldn't take this from you, but you should keep such a wonder safe. Take this.

PlayerPrompt: "Let nature be your answer, have a wyrdwood sprig."
NPCResponse: What odd flora. It appears to be calling out to me. I… I've forgotten to be present for nature's beauty. \n\nThank you, kind traveller. Take this as a token of my appreciation. Keep your light shining.

You can tell a fishing hotspot is active when you see fish jumping out of it.
<img src="lyshineui/images/tooltipimages/fishinghotspotactive.png" height="188"></img>
While it's active, landing your cast within the hotspot will yield quicker bites and rarer fish. When you place your line correctly, you'll see a small alert telling you you've hit the hotspot.

After enough fish are caught at a hotspot it will become depleted. You can tell a hotspot is depleted when there are no fish jumping.
<img src="lyshineui/images/tooltipimages/fishinghotspotdepleted.png" height="188"></img>
A depleted hotspot will become active again after some time has passed.

As your fishing skill improves, you will be able to find more and better hotspots.

Nature's fury - that's what happened! The Angry Earth's done claimed the territory!\n\nAnd not any Angry Earth like you've seen before - walking plants, vicious beasts… there's was even a damned Gorgon!
The ghosts whisper to the cloth through me. \n\nWe make the fabric do our bidding.
I've added wefts in the cloth, an art I learnt in Africa. \n\nCan you see the pattern or is it too fine? I outdo myself sometimes.
Ha! I craft my own indigo with Azoth and a plant I shall not name. \n\nOld world indigo can give you flame resistance. Matsukura's indigo can give you any power you choose.
Well, I couldn't depend on hemp, so I began making thread out of Azoth. \n\nStitching it into a cloth using the Patola technique gives it magical powers.
I soak the hemp in Azoth before stitching it into the fabric. \n\nThere are a few more steps, but no wise person gives all their secrets away.
I prefer keeping my techniques to myself. \n\nMy brother may be more forthcoming. He's so proud of finally succeeding, he can't contain himself.
How do I do it? How does anyone do it? \n\nI must have known at one time. But sadness erodes everything, even the memories I once held precious.
A true diva never reveals their secrets, honey. Especially to strangers, no matter how cute the strangers are. \n\nVisit me more and then maybe I'll tell you how I do this.

I don't do it. My pet weaverbirds do. Poor things dipped their beaks in Azoth a while ago. But it gave them magical powers. \n\nAnd no, I'm not going to show you the birds! I don't let the babies out of my house!!
The Goddess of the Sea showed me how to do this. \n\nI slept a while in her fragrant lap and she whispered the words to me. When I woke up, I could transform the cloth I wore.
My mother taught me the ancient art of Al Sadu. We make simple weaves with natural materials back home. \n\nBut, when I applied those same techniques here, I was able to transform cloth entirely.
Greek weavers know the beauty of a cloth is in its material. \n\nI create threads with plants which exude lightning. I then embroider motifs into the fabric with these threads.
I will tell you. But after the war. \n\nRight now, focus on how to strike our enemy.
Mon cherie, breathe in the nature around you. How could one not be inspired to do more? \n\nI found my calling in the magic of the thread. Now, it's your turn to surprise us.
